bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, November 26, 1952

div1.p: Truby tells Hench that he is depressed because he cannot attend the ceremonies in Cuba. He asks Hench to deliver the enclosed letter from himself to Jose Andreu thanking the Cuban government for including his name on the memorial.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, November 26, 1952
div1.opener:
ALBERT E. TRUBY
145 LAUREL STREET
SAN FRANCISCO 18, CALIFORNIA
November 26, 1952
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Your good letter of November 20, 1952, suggesting that
I write a letter expressing my appreciation of the honor
bestowed upon me by including my name on the bronze
placques, which are being prepared by the Cuban Government
for the dedication of the restored caseta in the little
park at old Camp Lazear, is greatly appreciated. However,
I had thought of the matter and hesitated to do anything
about it because my name does not appear on any of the
documents which I have received from the officials of
the Cuban Government. The only thing I knew about the
matter was what you sent me in Dr. Pedro Nogueira's
letter, and your own statements. Consequently, I was
afraid to take any definite action. However, I am sending
you an unsealed letter for Dr. Jose Andreu which you
can read and deliver when you know if my name has appeared
on the placques. If the letter should not be presented
for any reason, will you please use your own judgment
as to what should be done. Thanks for your kindness.

I am terribly depressed because I cannot be present
with you all at this event. I doubt if I know anybody
in Cuba except Dr. Nogueira. Please give him my very
best regards and thank him for his consideration and
interest in my behalf. I feel sure that the credit for
this belongs to him and to you. I know you will be
delighted by the whole affair and I think you have gained
your point. Pedro's last letter was most encouraging.
Please ask him to write me what he wants in the way of
a photograph. I have several to choose from.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Albert E. Truby
Brigadier General
U. S. Army, Retired. / Enclosure
Another invitation just came
from the President of Cuba through
the Minister de Salubridad etc
A E T
